comments.body: That's a really cool idea! Might be a bit too far fetched, though

for lag sake instead of them being immediately connected if you remove the bedrock layer and you fall to maybe -20Y and then you get the generating world screen like when you enter the nether and end currently

This was an actual thought of mine instead of making new dimensions, have it all in the same world but locked so that way to prevent lag and clear up space to allow for a sky dimension and space dimension. Although each dimension added this way would need to by spaced out equivalently for lag purposes and intentions. But overall I just don't see the point other then to remove lag.
Good idea!

I can't believe somebody already posted this! I had the exact same idea, with the sky biome and everything.

 

I don't think it needs to have a locked nether, getting a nether portal up is a very quick process, so it is not much of an obstacle anyway. Rather I think the nether portal should be used as a tool for convenience.

On that note, you could add a lot of lava instead of bedrock, so players would find it difficult to dig down. That and a lot of distance.

I would love to see the end be connected as well. The end could be the "space" dimension.

Maybe you could make a portal out of 4 Obsidian, 2 Netherrack on the bottom, 2 dirt on the top, and 4 End Stone. And it should take you to a big island separated by the 3 dimensions separated apart, with the mobs that belong to those sections of the the dimension, so Ghasts and Pigmen should be in the Nether sections, while Enderman and Shulker boxes be in the End sections, and Zombies, and passive mobs be in the Overworld sections, there would also be islands of these 3 dimensions
What if you were able too mine bedrock only with netherite? That wayportals wouldnt be useless.

This occurs because the algorithms that generate the world begin to break down when fed such large numbers.

If this was "fixed", then I would like the far lands to still be far lands, just deliberately different rather than accidentally different, with different terrain that gradually becomes more sparse until it is nonexistent, so you might fall into the void if you are not careful. There should be different mobs, too.
i think our computers just cant handle it
An easier way to fix this is to bring them closer to about 2 million.
whats mcbe?
I know this is probably not gonna get very far but I really want to see this in them game honestly I want someone to rebuild Ivor base from story mode
I strongly disagree, no player is gonna realistically head to the mcbe farlands in survival so I don't see why they should remove this cool harmless bug.
They can't fix it the same way they did in Java, because it would halve the world performance.

They can't fix it the same way they did in Java, because it would halve the world performance.

Why?
I like the idea, but the issue is there’s already a biome for the ghasts, the soul sand valley has absurd ghast spawns. Maybe this could be changed however
My idea is to have it a mini-biome within the soul sand valley
I feel like this would be better as a mini biome within the Nether Waste. Personally, I think the Soul Sand Valley should spawn a new mob instead of Ghasts (Nether Hound).
The singed shrub could be brewed into potion of floating.
Maybe there could be valuable loot in those abandoned buildings since it is very faraway from spawn
Maybe the desert can have glass under the sand and lava spawns more in the desert biome also bellow Y30 diffront ores spwans more than other biomes,
J'aime vraiment l'idée d'un biome comme celui-ci . Et pour les villages abandonné pourquoi pas un village du Far ouest en ruine . Sinon j'ai voté pour l'idée

Sagittarius: 2 extra damage with bow.
Aquarius: longer underwater breathing time.
Cancer: more damage to water mobs.
Probably more...
Stars

So does this biome have land or would the player be floating? This idea is great but do we just float around and see 16 constellations? so does this biome have some portal or blocks, new items? ANYTHING?

I'm seeing this too, I just spent an hour a half getting wood. I cut down exactly 69 jungle trees and only got 58 saplings, when I cut down no more than 10 oak trees it dropped a stack and 8 saplings...

Agreed. I just settled in a jungle, and after clearing away a bunch of trees, I can barely replant what I had. The main appeal to me of settling in a jungle is the dense environment. It's not like fortune helps either. At Fortune III, jungle saplings only drop 4.18% of the time, which is about 1% lower than all other saplings drop normally. 

The amount of leaves shouldn't matter, especially considering there's a taiga tree variant that's like 80% leaves. I can't see it being a griefing problem when something like lava casting is far more time efficient, and if it were a griefing issue, people would already be using spruce wood.

I guess I don't see how jungle wood is superior enough to spruce, where it would warrant a nerf that large.
It really isn't fair how hard it is to even break even growing Jungle trees. I don't want to destroy a biome just to have a pretty kind of wood.
Dark Oak as well.

I always thought it was weird for the bushes using different types of leaves, but I have no problem with oak trees being in the jungle. But obviously the main issue here and the one that bothers me is how extremely rare jungle saplings are, if you chop down trees you literally can't even plant them again, and there will be forever one less tree in your world.
Please increase jungle sapling rate so that the trees are renewable

I feel like the drop rate for jungle saplings needs to double. I cut down one jungle tree and I barely get enough to replant it, much less have enough to be able to plant more. The fact that these trees have more leaves than oak trees and somehow still drop less saplings overall feels weird to me.
like it! maybe there should be lanterns in the trees only around villages.
instead of stone, it could be Diorite!
You should post these on Reddit too, they'd get more recognition!
Im working on a mod adding biome overhauls, can I use this one?
I love the idea of redoing this biome. The exact changes could be a little different, but this biome could definitely use more character.
SnailMan565 Of Course!
yeeeeeeeeeeee so gud
love it
Imagine 100+ block tall trees with bases 5×5 blocks thick! It'd be so epic!!
So cool
this will never be added to minecraft

I agree with this dude maybe you could add like different biomes with these cool crystals where you can mind them with a nether right silk touch pickax or any soft touch pickax except for stone and wood and gold
Totally agree! I've just came to vote every idea about this after watching this video of Wattles. It's really cool, no more words to say!

i have an idea! how about one of the mobs is another boss? we could definitely do with more bosses. or you could make an entire boss cave or something? like bowser's castle? and some mob ideas are one like an enderman but it is pretty rare and can teleport to any dimension. just some thoughts.

Yeah, that would be cool, and maybe there could also be like some sort of scary monkey thing that follows you in the dark and takes your torches away then it attacks you when you least expect it. Then when you kill it, it will drop all the torches it broke and then maybe some new really good drop.

But maybe if people don't like it and the Developers wont make them break the torches, they should just lurk around in the dark waiting for you to run out of light or for you to run into a dark cave.

I have a thought! Maybe a new spider that when it hits you you have blindness for 5 seconds, however to even things out the spiders would be kinda uncommon and would drop spider fangs that could be used to make special items or armour (Maybe with a blindness effect to others, if so it would be useful in pvp and pvp servers.)

maybe a new structure like a mineshaft that has a different thing like the 1.16 fungus woods for the wood in these mineshafts, but these ones have portals to the nether and the overworld like the nether ones in ruins in the overworld.
Yeah! that would be cool. maybe there could be different kinds of mineshafts down there too, and there could be a lot of ruined portals.
GHOST COULD BE ADDED IN THIS DIMENSION AND STONE MONSTER POWER FULL.
GHOST COULD BE ADDED IN THIS DIMENSION AND STONE MONSTER POWER FULL.

I dont know if you are plaaning to change the "altitude" of the earth. For exemple now we have block 60 aproximately for surface. If you want to add really depth to the cave world you should go for block 100 at surface for exmple or more ! what do you think ?
So like a labyrinth city dimension, and it could have several eras of architecture
I feel like this could be a real minecraft feature, also could we call it the infinite city I feel it sounds better

Wow, I got chills reading this. This sounds like a great Idea. I feel like maybe in the overworld there could be a chance for rare books to spawn in chests, like in mineshafts, and they could give you a small amount of information about the dimension. And if you find enough books it could tell you how to get to the dimension? Or maybe tell you where the portal thing for the dimension is.
How you described it made me want them to add it to the game.    10/10
I really like the vibe you're describing, but does it necessarily have to be a whole new dimension? I feel like a revamp of the End Cities could achieve this well if executed somewhat differently.

I really like this idea. I think that the portal should be found in villages or in woodland mansions and the creatures there are zombie villagers or illagers and an advancement/achievement for this dimension can be Repopulation: Cure 10 zombie villagers in this dimension.

i LOVE this idea and while reading this I got a whole picture of it in my head, with a utopia like environment surrounding the cities, but a strange, rather off putting vipe to the cities making them seem to be abandoned out of nowhere like the underwater temples and other things but as if they never left from there, as if… you know what I’m thinking, right? I think this would be fantastic to add to the game. However, there is one issue. This would be amazing in the game but it would take a long time to make happen. Besides that, I think that this new dimension rather than just new structure could completely change how long term players view the game, don’t ya think? Anyway, have a good evening mister genius
Great idea VengefulPotato7! I would love that addition! It's pretty smart idea to call the mobs "withered"! I'm definitely voting for this!

I don't get it why its called 'The beginning'. right after defeating the ender dragon? in the End? but cool idea. I like that The beginning have a place for withers. It was more likely for the withers to not have a place to stay, Thanks to your idea the wither finally have something to do then creating it and defeating it. I am going to vote you for this great idea. YOUR WELCOME.😁
yes, he could also spawn the portal near the stronghold after killing the dragon.
This could be a good way to implement a slime boss and some new potions.
Like all of the loot except for diamonds. They need to be rarer.

Some more ideas:

* Some walls are made of ordinary stone, but it has a "slimy" look inside this biome, much like how grass changes color in different biomes.

*Pools of liquid slime or acid, a new greenish liquid that could be put in buckets and have its own interesting mechanics, like being super slippery or corroding through certain blocks.

*A new mob, maybe a slug or snail, that lives in the ooze, and eats slime balls.
This is an amazing idea! I don't think the slimy sword should be better than a diamond sword though. I think it should be slightly worse than a diamond sword, but better than an iron sword.

Slime caves or dens themselves area a wonderful idea! ...But the boss and its drop are uninspiring at best. The "slime witch" can already be done with spawners.

Larger slimes however could be a nice idea, adding a greater challenge as normal slimes are weak.

Another possibility is perhaps a bouncier slime variant? Something unique to give the slime cave extra flare. It and its drops could perhaps behave like a bouncy ball. Perhaps even something like the orange gel from Portal 2?

Huts or structures covered in slime could also make it interesting as well as add a hint of lore.

The main issue I see is that getting slime blocks would be too easy and make slimes largely useless with that supply of slime blocks. It'd probably have to be comprised of a new block that won't do that.

I agree, I would like to have a fog in a given biome at any time of the day, so that the horror of a given biome is supercharged, I imagine this forest (generated with AI) like this

https://imgur.com/a/TOgnHdo
Wow , good Idea ... EVERYONE wants a Sky Dimension in Vanilla MC 👍👏
Yes.. but I'm on bedrock.

I feel like the Aether dimension will open a whole new world of opportunities.

In my opinion, the Aether dimension should be the only dimension that has no Endermen due to how it requires water to make the portal.

I love this idea! This a great idea to go back to were it all began, this could also include improved tree generation (making them bigger and more realistic) plus with some new food types (that hang off the trees)
Good I'loviu idea
Plz
Very nice update
I think you should add when you cut down a tree it falls or add a stump to it
This idea is very good for someone who plays the role of pirates or who is sailing to look for treasures
I like this idea, maybe even add pillagers riding on boats kind of like pirates, that would be great.
I like this idea :D maybe was interesting to see other animals (for ex. Giant turtles, marine iguanas, galapagos penguins)
Tropical Slime spawn here.
it would be really cool to have tropical islands in Minecraft, it could also have a new tree for the island, a coconut tree
Sounds great. Maybe add some "firestorm" regions aswell? So if you go to that area you'll get burnt up

cool idea but i dont think it should just be a nether verion of a desert biome but i love the idea of making an ash biome that has ash blocks witch can be turned into glass with blazes and things like that. still I really like this suggestion
This would be great for blazes in the nether, because they shouldn't just spawn in fortresses.
Feel free to share your views on Rainforests in Minecraft! Also, lets get this awesome biome in Minecraft so we can learn to look after the Amazon Rainforest #Save The Amazon!

The tree trunk could look like oak, but more jungle wood coloured. Planks could be lightly spotted, the colour of jungle planks, oak planks and birch planks together. This idea for rainforests is really cool!

 

I myself visit Brazil sometimes, and I go to a city where the forest is only a few minutes drive away!
A good number of people want proper waterfalls and rivers. If water generation was improved then a rainforest could potentially be the best biome added in a LOOONG time.
I like the idea
This makes sense as it will add up to the upside-down growing vines in warped forests. Also, maybe some warped trees generate on the ceiling of the biome?

I agree with this statement, this will make the forest feel more "unique". Perhaps the tree could spawn from the ceiling rather than on the ground. However, while I think the warped forest is quite unique lore wise (Endermen spawning in abundance), I feel like they need to do more than just make Endermen spawn and recolour a biome to make it greatly contrast with the crimson. Perhaps a new structure unique to the warped forest would be good (don't know what it should be though, sorry).
Do you mean generating on the roof upside down?

I like this idea. It wouldn't add much to the biome, but it could be a fun little idea that would make the biome slightly more interesting. You have my vote.

Verdict: A small change, but a good one deserving of a vote.
I like the idea, but it would probably make more sense to have them grow upside down from roof tops instead. Also, it would fit with both biomes

I love this idea you made there, making some of the huge warped fungus grow from the nether roof or growing upside down will make the warped forest feel more special and different from the crimson forest. Especially with this other idea of the huge warped fungus at https://feedback.minecraft.net/hc/en-us/community/posts/360058281191-Different-huge-warped-fungus in feedback

yes, it would also be cool if we could get a mushroom temple with rare loot. since the biome is rare make it a unique experience so when you find one you want to go and explore. I really hope that after the cave update this is next.

It does need an update there are actually like 4 blocks that generate in them, other than dirt and stone. 
The mushroom grass, I forgot it's name, and the mushroom blocks.

mushroom island is a very rare but unattractive biome, an update that would add a totally exclusive village would be really cool, it would be a much bigger village than the others, with its own villagers and more robust giant mushrooms, at night there could be fireflies that would be just glowing particles of different colors, as well as luminous mushrooms, making this peaceful island a truly magical discovery. thanks for reading :)

sincerely, the mushroom update (or this can be part of a possible biome update) is necesary, I don´t think  that mushroom village is a good idea, because so much biomes have village and I think that mushroom biome is special, for this reason I think one idea than can become the mushrom biome in one of the most importants biomes in minecraft, a exclusive mini boss, i think in a structure, this structure can be a form of villager head (like heads of pascua island), in this hipotetical structure generate the corrupt golem, this mini boss atack you, if you defeat him, you will receive the golem heart (or something like this) and with this object, if you create a structure of esmerald, diamonds or netherite you will prevent monsters appearing in a area, this area will depend of the mineral with you do the structure, other idea than I have from mushroom biome is that the biome will appering in a 3.5 porcent of times (is more porcent than now), and other use of this biome will be the food, why? because mushroom soup will be stackeable (16) and will regenerate 7 of food, in compensation the saturation of this food will be very bad, that are some of my ideas of the mushroom update

I got an idea what if we added smaller and bigger forms of the mushrooms so we have are two tips of mushrooms the big and small but what if they grew in stages so you have the small mushroom we know and love we have the new medium mushroom so it is not as big of a deafferents between the small and big mushroom and than you have the mage mushroom that will grow mushrooms all around it over time. so did you like my idea?
They haven't been updated for year's I agree
I would live a village, more types of mushrooms, and a walking mushroom mob. Some more greenery and structures on the island would be nice as well

Since no hostile mobs spawn in the mushroom biome, I think it should be kept that way. But maybe there could be new types of mushrooms, glowing mushrooms and poison mushrooms for exapmle. The biome should stay peaceful and safe, but with some more lushness and plant life added, as well as possibly a new rare structure and a mushroom themed mob (mushroom golem?).
Great idea! I would totally live in one of those biomes if it gets implemented.
AHHHH YESS! MAYBE PUFFINS LIVE THERE!  I LOVE PUFFINSSS
I think this is an excellent idea, but I think adding a new stone, just for the cliffside, that does not do anything special is pointless.
@TheIronSniper1   Lots of blocks don't do anything, they're for building with.  But you're right, brownstone could probably generate in some other places as well.
or maybe other aukes like guilimots and razorbills
Guillemots and Razorbills are very cool. Arctic foxes need food!
I like this idea. A cool variant could be like a rocky cliff too with lots of rocks and stuff in the water. The coast is not always perfect and seamless in real life, why should it be in minecraft?
This is what the Caves & Cliffs update needs!
Yes we need the end update, I was thinking about an upside-down ocean with a new fluid that floes opposite of water.

There could be new types of End trees that only grow on Endstylium which would allow the the player to obtain wood in the End. There could even be new mobs that generate here like End spiders or specters that spawn in the ruins. Let me know if you like this idea. I feel like End trees might not fit the style you were going for but let me know. Your ideas are great and hope to see them in Minecraft someday!

The end needs a whole new start maybe the endermen should be smarter like villagers and Piglins I think the boss should be changed too Why the ender dragon and endermen should be fighting each other and new plants will be awesome too

I like the concept, but I don't know how much your suggestions would add. We already have shulkers and endermites. We already have cool loot. 

 

If you could elaborate on some new features to be found in the biome, you would 100% have a vote.
Could it also have a chance of having a cherry blossom forest on top?

Well, the End is a complex place that has a lot of lore. Saying specific features is difficult. The only extra thing I want and that I would have put here would have been some kind of End trees.

I'm leaving this to discussion, because you people make suggestions better. (And also, if I edit this probably would get deleted, :| ).

I think you could make a little village of advanced enderman. They could have different occupations, like chorus farmer, which would trade chorus fruit, or a flightsmith, which can trade phantom membrane and very rarely elytra.
Maybe there should be a ruined structure (kinda like Bastions) which has unique loot, tons of endermen, lots of traps, and a new type of hostile end creature that will throw things at you.
I think a better name for "Endstylium" is "Vocilyum" like a void mycileum nylium (yes i know it used y instead of e)
I just want to point out for folks looking, this is a good way to write a biome post. The picture is a little dark, but the text is well laid out.
Agreed, because the weird soul sand valley edge lines that currently separate the two biomes are ugly.

Well, it looks like the nether update will soon be coming to an end, so please! If you enjoyed this feature share it! We've got one more chance to get it officially added to the game! Either way, thanks for the support and positive feedback.
This would be a neat biome to add into Minecraft.
